title: A Multi-Agent Approach to Dermatology Assistance
author: Radiant Group
excerpt: How Radiant combined vision, retrieval, and reasoning agents for dermatological support.
content:
## Context
Dermatology requires perception, knowledge, and communication.

## Problem Statement
Single-model systems conflate responsibilities and obscure failures.

## Design Principles
- Agent specialization
- Explicit handoffs
- Evidence grounding

## System Overview
Detection, retrieval, and synthesis are handled by separate agents.

## Technical Choices
Medical knowledge is retrieved explicitly rather than embedded implicitly.

## Evaluation
Each agent is evaluated independently.

## Limitations
The system does not replace clinical diagnosis.

## Lessons Learned
Agent boundaries improve safety.

## Conclusion
Multi-agent systems align better with medical reasoning.
